title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 86.13 - Equipment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 86.13 - Equipment

State Regulations

Rods, vents, taps, hoses (rubber or metal), choke or
restrictor coil not exceeding 10 feet in length to any one line, washers, couplings, vent tongues, valves, bungs, gauges, regulators, distributors, connectors, cellar thermometers, tap markers, bucks, rod brushes, air cocks, air tees, metal tubing to connect regulators and gauges, necessary parts to
faucets including faucet bodies, spigots, unions and bottle openers may be
furnished, given or sold to a retailer and installed in his establishment. Picnic pumps, gravity keys, tubs, portable bars, cold plates, gauges, portable
cooling units and refrigerated trucks or trailers may be furnished, loaned or
rented for temporary use at a particular function, but not for use by a retail
licensee in the normal day-to-day operation of his business; carbon dioxide or
other propellant may be furnished or sold for use in connection with the
operation of such equipment. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
86.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
